questions.subject: Nursing Foundation
questions.explanation: Testbook solution confirms 30:2 as the standard CPR ratio in the cited context.

questions.subject: Medical-Surgical Nursing
questions.question_text: A patient arrives after an RTA: Pulse 127/min, BP 90/56, cold extremities. The nurse suspects which type of shock?
questions.explanation: Tachycardia with hypotension in trauma context is consistent with hypovolemic shock.

questions.subject: Nursing Procedures
questions.question_text: A nurse notes redness, tenderness and slowed IV flow at an IV cannula site. The correct interpretation and action are:
questions.explanation: Redness, tenderness and reduced flow indicate phlebitis requiring cannula removal.

questions.subject: Neurology
questions.question_text: Maximum & minimum score of GCS are:
questions.explanation: The Glasgow Coma Scale spans from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 15.

questions.subject: Obstetrics
questions.question_text: The relation between the fetal presenting part and maternal pelvis is known as:
questions.explanation: Fetal position describes relation of the presenting part to maternal pelvis landmarks.
